parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
A papyrus roll. A diminutive of biblos; a roll.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
On the right hand, right hand, right. From dechomai; the right side or hand.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
From eso; from inside; also used as equivalent to eso.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To seal up, secure with a seal. From kata and sphragizo; to seal closely.
Probably strengthened from phrasso; a signet; by implication, the stamp impressed, literally or figuratively.
